titleStmt.title: Councill humbly propounded for the speedy settlement of these long disturbed nations. Wherein is offered such a King, such a church-government, such liberty for tender consciences, as that the royalist, Presbiterian, and persons of different judgements (the three great interests of our nations) may acquiess in.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by M. Simmons, for H.C.,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
